stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the session designing and problem-solving for the interconnected overworld.  He experiments with ways to gate access to Part 13 (a beach area) after Bowser 2, sketches the volcano zone, plans secret shortcuts, and roughs out several overworld events and side-quests.

development_findings.summary: After Bowser 2 the player can reach five new areas at once, so Part 13 & 15 will be locked behind an event rather than a simple star count.
development_findings.quote: If you just go here and here and here right away, that’s overwhelming.  I want to block off the beach party at the end.

development_findings.summary: Decision to use Yoshi’s Island ‘Yappy Blocks’ as physical barriers; Kamek enchants them into hostile forms.  Defeating an overworld Kamek fight restores the blocks, which then move aside to open Part 13.
development_findings.quote: Evil message block that insults you in rhymes.  Beat the Kamek boss fight in Part 5; they apologise and slide out of the way.

development_findings.summary: Bone Dragon (one-headed version of Yoshi’s Story bone dragon) added to volcano area.  Player punches rotten tooth to befriend it; the dragon then ferries Mario to a rising-lava side level.
development_findings.quote: As soon as you punch his tooth, his eyes change to friendly… Hey, if you want you can climb on my head and I can take you for a ride.

development_findings.summary: Optional follow-up quest: spend coins at a local smith to craft a gold tooth for the dragon, rewarding a star and a permanent happy animation.
development_findings.quote: After you befriend him, the smith can smelt 200 coins into a gold tooth you carry to the dragon for a star.

development_findings.summary: Secret back entrance to Course 1: push a rock over a bunny burrow, crawl through an underground tunnel into the windmill interior containing a blue-coin challenge; purely for curiosity, not progression.
development_findings.quote: Adding a secret back entrance here that does nothing is kind of cool.

development_findings.summary: Pause menu will feature a full overworld map that unrolls like a parchment when the player presses pause.
development_findings.quote: When you open the pause menu, an animation of this type of map unrolling happens.

development_findings.summary: Planned ‘Boobla infestation’ event: opening a Pandora’s Box above Course 5 unleashes ghosts; clearing them awards a star.
development_findings.quote: If you open it, Booblas burst out and haunt the area.  Destroy all the Booblas for a star.

development_findings.summary: Overworld geometry kept low-poly (≈8800 triangles current) until layout finalised; Kaze notes collision bug in Area 5 and triangle budget issues.
development_findings.quote: Man, I didn’t want to spend my time on this today… Wait, this is 3000 triangles? What the hell?

development_findings.summary: Instant warp seams will be replaced later; ultimate goal is one seamless 360° island with no loading zones.
development_findings.quote: Imagine: the whole world feels like a gigantic open world… you just go from thing to thing.

development_findings.summary: Kaze plans private beta-testing via a Discord pool; will send ROMs to selected players and review uncut footage to study behaviour, not just bugs.
development_findings.quote: I need a reliable way to just find people willing to play my game… I look at the entire uncut footage.

context_findings.summary: Kaze lives on East Coast Canada (moved in 2021); jokes about U.S. taxes vs Canadian healthcare.
context_findings.quote: Yes, I live in Canada, I moved to Canada in 2021.

context_findings.summary: Expresses aversion to office environments and large groups; prefers solo work.
context_findings.quote: When I have people around me for too long, I get extremely tilted.

context_findings.summary: Shows frustration with unexpected Blender collision bug but quickly pivots to other tasks, demonstrating iterative workflow.
Commissioned to create a separate game ‘Drag Wars’; indicates paid contract work supports him.
context_findings.quote: Drag Wars is a game that I’ve been commissioned to make.  Someone paid me to make the whole thing.

biobak.summary: Provides feedback during brainstorming (e.g., windmill entrance practicality, coin economy).

key_stories.title: Gating the Beach (Part 13)
key_stories.summary: After Bowser 2, too many overworld sections open at once.  Kaze brainstorms how to restrict access, rejects star doors and hide-and-seek ideas, and finally lands on enchanted Yappy Blocks plus an overworld Kamek fight.
key_stories.challenge: Prevent player overload once Parts 10-12 unlock simultaneously.
key_stories.process: Considered star barriers, bird NPC, hide-and-seek blocks; weighed risk of frustration; searched for thematic Yoshi’s Island solution.
key_stories.outcome: Settled on rhyming Yappy Blocks hexed by Kamek; defeating Kamek returns them to normal and they move away, opening Part 13.
key_stories.key_quote: I think the talking block is the right character… evil message block that insults you and rhymes—beat Kamek and they apologise and move.

key_stories.title: Befriending the Bone Dragon
key_stories.summary: Kaze conceives a volcano-dwelling Bone Dragon who is angry due to a rotten tooth.  Mario removes the tooth, turning the creature into an ally that serves as an elevator to a secret level, with an optional gold-tooth upgrade for a star.
key_stories.challenge: Create a memorable NPC interaction that subverts expectation of a boss fight.
key_stories.process: Explored splinter, chiropractor, missing bones; settled on tooth cavity; discussed coin cost for gold tooth.
key_stories.outcome: Design locked: punch rotten tooth → dragon friendly → access side level; later craft gold tooth for extra star.
key_stories.key_quote: Isn’t it way funnier if the boss fight you expect isn’t there?  He was just in a bad mood because of a cavity.

key_stories.title: Secret Windmill Entrance
key_stories.summary: To add exploration value, Kaze designs an underground burrow leading into the unreachable windmill in Course 1, containing a blue-coin cache.
key_stories.challenge: Players repeatedly try to enter windmill; current collision denies it.
key_stories.process: Debated purpose; decided purely optional secret reachable much later via hidden tunnel.
key_stories.outcome: Planned rock-covered bunny hole entrance with burrow to windmill interior; adds coins but no star progression.
key_stories.key_quote: Half a year later, when you reach the third overworld, you finally get there—what the fuck?
